abstract: New York City officials announce that they have ended stand-off with Norman Brodsky, and have agreed to pay $160 million for 11-acre parcel of land along East River in Brooklyn; acquisition will allow city to complete Bushwick Inlet Park by joining its northern and southern halves together.

headline.print_headline: City Spends $160 Million on Last Tract for Williamsburg Waterfront Park
headline.main: New York Buys Last Tract for Williamsburg Waterfront Park for $160 Million

snippet: The city said this week it had acquired the outstanding portion of Bushwick Inlet Park, a green space meant to transform an industrial stretch along the East River in Brooklyn....
lead_paragraph: The city said this week it had acquired the outstanding portion of Bushwick Inlet Park, a green space meant to transform an industrial stretch along the East River in Brooklyn.
